title: Materials Up on Renewed Trade-Deal Hopes — Materials Roundup
text:
Producers of metals and other raw materials rose amid renewed hope for a trade deal between the U.S. and China.

Speaking on CNBC television, U.S. trade negotiator Peter Navarro disputed the accuracy a Bloomberg News report that the U.S. was considering blocking access to its stock exchanges by Chinese companies.

One brokerage said miner Anglo American is poised to grow faster than its rivals. "We believe Anglo American is differentiating itself from its peers in two key ways: growth and technological innovation," said analysts at brokerage Credit Suisse, in a research note.

Gold futures fell sharply on Monday, settling at their lowest in two months as strength in the dollar weighed on precious-metals prices.
